scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
XHTML is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to Estonia and Spain.
The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

National catalogue Estonia: 
https://www.mkm.ee/sites/default/files/interoperability-framework_2011.doc

National catalogue Spain:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The specification is one of the main markup languages to develop web resources. XHTML is aligned with 3 out of 5 levels of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star, it makes data available on the Web, it publishes the data in a structured way and it makes data available in a non-proprietary open format. So, the specification is highly aligned with the different levels of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star schema for Open Data.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
XHTML is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including XHTML.

W3C Patent practice:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including XHTML.

W3C Patent practice:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
XHTML appears from the reformulation of HTML4 using XML. XHTML 1.0 became a World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) recommendation on 26 January 2000. There have been multiple updates with new versions of XHTML, for example in XHTML 1.1 became a W3C recommendation on 31 May 2001. There is a development of XHTML5 which is an XML adaptation of the HTML5 specification. This fact proves that the specification is mature enough for its use in the development of products and services.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
When XHTML became W3C recommendation it had a good acceptance, but when HTML5 appeared, its use has been decreased considerably. In the following link there is a comparison of usage of the different HTML languages and it can be seen that XHTML 1.0 is declining more and more while HTML5 is increasing.

XHTML trend:
https://try.powermapper.com/Stats/HtmlVersions

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: At the moment of performing the assessment, XHTML is used in some cases to develop web pages. However, with the increasing usage of HTML5, no evidences have been found to consider XHTML as an asset to build innovative solutions.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
XHTML is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 

Developer community W3C:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is to publish administrative data on the web, as one of the main languages used in web development, XHTML helps and fosters the visibility of administration data and services. Moreover, it also eases the decision-making process by ensuring the data exchange and data reuse. 

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is to publish administrative data on the web. By allowing to publish custom data in an understandable format, it fosters the comprehensibility of administrative data. Moreover, it also eases the decision-making process by ensuring the data exchange and data reuse.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is not related to the availability of interfaces with internal information systems. Therefore, this criterion does not apply to this specification.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement:
XHTML is a business domain agnostic specification that can be reused in a cross-domain way.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
XHTML is publicly available for implementation and use for free on W3C's webpage. Therefore, it can be reused by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
XHTML can be found for free along within the European Collaborative Platform, Joinup.

XHTML in Joinup platform:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/xhtmltm-10-extensible-hypertext-markup-language-second-edition

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
Although XHTML is a reformulation of HTML 4 using XML, it is not dependant of any version of the two standards. So, XHTML is independent of any technology or software.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
XHTML is a family of current and future document types and modules that reproduce, subset, and extend HTML 4. XHTML is a full programming environment for cross-platform applications with access to device capabilities and accepts all types of files to be published. It is intended to be used as a language for content that is both XML-conforming and, if some simple guidelines are followed, operates in HTML 4 conforming user agents.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
XHTML is one of the main markup languages to develop web resources. XHTML files are used to exchange information through the web. So this fact proves that XHTML fosters data portability between systems and applications.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
By helping administrations to access and reuse information across borders, the implementation of XHTML and other standards from HTML family can help to foster and ease the Once-Only Principle.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
XHTML fosters e-accessibility helping people with disabilities to understand and navigate through web and mobile web applications with friendly tools and proper information formats. 
Moreover, the Regional Government of Bizkaia developed his website to promote the integration of groups with disabilities into the Public Administration of Bizkaia. They used XHTML 1.0 recommendations and CSS2.

XHTML 1.0 implemented in e-accessability project:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/einclusion/document/eaccesibility-public-administration-bizkaia-bizkaianet

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
XHTML has some features to prevent possible security vulnerabilities. Moreover, by allowing to exchange data via online websites, XHTML fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between administrations and stakeholders. 

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
Although XHTML's purpose is not to foster the delivery of multilingual European public services, several websites contain multilingual parallel texts and are developed in XHTML. In the following link, there is an explanation of the architecture of multilingual websites.

Open architecture for multilingual websites:
http://dragoman.org/mws/oamws.pdf

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
By allowing public administration to have an online domain where they can publish all types of administrative data, documents, videos, etc, the specification reduces the administrative burden. 

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is not related to long term preservation of electronic records. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification. 

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the XHTML in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
XHTML is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, XHTML can define the interoperability aspects of the "Representation" ABB of the EIRA Semantic View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
W3C provides a Markup Validation Service for free to validate Web documents including XHTML implementations.

W3C Markup Validation Service:
https://validator.w3.org/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
8 Member States are recommending XHTML in their ICT National Catalogues. This Member States are Estonia, France, Germany, Greece, Norway, Poland, Slovenia and Spain.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
XHTML has been used to publish some online documents of the European Commission. For example, Eur-lex used XHTML to publish a proposal for a regulation on a mechanism to resolve legal and administrative obstacles in a cross-border context.

XHTML implementation by Eur-lex:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/HTML/?uri=CELEX:52018PC0373&from=EN

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 8 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. This Member States are Estonia, France, Germany, Greece, Norway, Poland, Slovenia and Spain.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of XHTML within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

CENELEC search tool catalogue:
https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidence has been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
XHTML has been assessed by the CAMSS Team under the MSP scenario, which is fully compliant with the European standardisation regulation 1025/2012. However, the assessment under MSP scenario is XHTML 1.1 and in the current assessment is XHTML 1.0.

XHTML 1.1 MSP scenario:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/camss-assessment-xhtml-11-msp-scenario

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion does not apply to the specification.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of XHTML is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion does not apply to the specification.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
XHTML is an application of XML, it is based on HTML 4, but it uses XML syntax which defines a well-formed and more restrictive data model. It can be used for exchanging data across sectors.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Although XHTML is aligned with the different levels of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star schema for Open Data, it does not support the different principles of Linked Open Data.

XHTML W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
